intro: Erythroxylum laurel var. rotundatum, commonly known as the round-leaved erythroxylum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Erythroxylaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains minute seeds, and it is often found in lowland rainforests. This variety is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological significance.
